alert.note: Alert for Greene (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:55AM CDT until March 29 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Christian, Greene, Lawrence, Stone, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported numerous roads closed due to flooding from previous heavy rainfall in the warned area. Between 2 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen, with an additional 0.5 to 1 inches of rain expected through the afternoon. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Crane Creek at Old Wire Road, James River at Bell Ford Road, Elk Creek at Highway Z, Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road, Whetstone Creek at Owens Road, Wilson`s Creek at Old Limey Road and Green Valley Creek at Holder RD. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 64 and 106. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
